definitions.definition: To possess a certain extent; to cover an amount of space.
examples: The desert extended for miles in all directions.

definitions.definition: To cause to increase in extent .
To cause to last for a longer period of time .
To bestow; to offer; to impart; to apply.
examples: to extend sympathy to the suffering
to extend credit to a valued customer

definitions.definition: To increase in quantity by weakening or adulterating additions.
examples: There's little stew left, but we can always extend it by adding more potatoes.

definitions.definition: To value, as lands taken by a writ of extent in satisfaction of a debt; to assign by writ of extent.
Of a class : to be an extension or subtype of, or to be based on, a prototype or a more abstract class.
examples: The classes Person and Dog extend the class Animal .

definitions.definition: To reenlist for a further period.

secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To possess a certain extent; to cover an amount of space.
( transitive ) To cause to increase in extent .
( transitive ) To cause to last for a longer period of time .
( transitive ) To bestow; to offer; to impart; to apply.
To increase in quantity by weakening or adulterating additions.
( UK , law ) To value, as lands taken by a writ of extent in satisfaction of a debt; to assign by writ of extent.
( object-oriented programming ) Of a class : to be an extension or subtype of, or to be based on, a prototype or a more abstract class.
( intransitive , US , military ) To reenlist for a further period.
